s.text: Hookworm has proven to be extremely difficult to eliminate or eradicate in areas of poverty and poor sanitation.

High transmission (defined below) also occurs in other areas of rural poverty in the tropics, including southern China [5], the Indian subcontinent [6], and the Americas [7].
Among the health benefits of periodic deworming of schoolchildren are improvements in iron and hemoglobin status, physical growth and fitness, and cognition [20,21,22,23].
